variantManagement.description:
Determines whether variant management is enabled for tables:
- None (default): Variant management is disabled.
- Control: Variant management can be enabled individually for each control using personalization.

editableHeaderContent.description: Set editableHeaderContent to true to make the header fields editable.

visible.description: Set visible to true to make the header visible.

anchorBarVisible.description: Determines whether the anchor bar is displayed.

position.description: Defines the position of the action relative to the anchor action.

text.description: The text that is displayed on the button (typically a binding to an i18n entry).

press.description: Relevant for extension actions; allows the definition of a target action handler.

visible.description: Defines if the action button is visible.

enabled.description: Defines if the action is enabled. The default value is true.

anchor.description: The key of another action to be used as placement anchor.

placement.description: Define the placement, either before or after the anchor action.

afterExecution.description: Settings that control the behavior after creating a new entry.

navigateToInstance.description: Allows you to disable the navigation. By default, navigation is automatically triggered after you have performed an action.

enableAutoScroll.description: Allows you to scroll to the newly created or changed item after you have performed an action.

showRelatedApps.description: Set showRelatedApps to true to show the navigation button for related apps.

AdditionalSemanticObjects.description: Adds additional links under the Related Apps button by specifying semantic objects.

allowedActions.description: Define the list of semantic object links displayed under the Related Apps button.

unavailableActions.description: Determines the navigation actions of the semantic object that are hidden from under the Related Apps button.

mapping.description: Mapping, defined for a semantic object, consists of key value pairs. The key defines the way in which the source application (object page) passes the context. The value represents the term used for the same entity in the target app.

stashed.description: Header facets marked as stashed are initially not visible on the UI. Key users can add these header facets via key user adaptation.

flexSettings.description: Defines the key user adaptation behavior of the header facet.

designtime.description: Defines which settings are available for key user adaptation at design time.

stashed.description: Header facets marked as stashed are initially not visible on the UI. Key users can add these header facets via key user adaptation.

flexSettings.description: Defines the key user adaptation behavior of the header facet.

stashed.description: Header facets marked as stashed are initially not visible on the UI. Key users can add these header facets via key user adaptation.

flexSettings.description: Defines the key user adaptation behavior of the header facet.

stashed.description: Header facets marked as stashed are initially not visible on the UI. Key users can add these header facets via key user adaptation.

flexSettings.description: Defines the key user adaptation behavior of the header facet.

templateEdit.description: The fragment for the editable version of the header facet.

requestGroupId.description: Defines the loading behavior of the Object Page header.

flexSettings.description: Defines the key user adaptation behavior of the header facet.

visible.description: Defines if the header facet is displayed in the header area.

fragmentName.description: The path to the XML template containing the section control.

relatedFacet.description: Use the key of another section as a placement anchor.

relativePosition.description: Define the placement, either before or after the anchor section.

title.description: The label of a custom section, preferably as an i18n key.

stashed.description: Header facets marked as stashed are initially not visible on the UI. Key users can add these header facets via key user adaptation.

designtime.description: Defines which settings are available for key user adaptation at design time.

sectionLayout.description:
Defines the layout of the sections.
- Page (default): In this mode, all the sections and subsections are added to the same page.
- Tabs: In this mode, the sections are represented as tabs under the header facet.

type.description: Defines the table type. Note: Grid tables, analytical tables, and tree tables aren't rendered on small-screen devices. Responsive tables are shown instead.

enableFullScreen.description: Enables full screen mode for this table. This adds a button to the table toolbar which opens the table in a full screen dialog.

enablePaste.description: In the Object Page tables, it is possible to add several items at a time by copying and pasting data from an excel file, if this property is set to true.

personalization.description:
Defines the personalization mode which is only effective if the variant management on the page is set to `Page` or `Control`.
By default all table settings are enabled. You can change this for the different parts of the table by setting the properties 'Column', 'Sort' and 'Filter' accordingly.
Omitting a property is treated as false, this allows apps to avoid getting new features like grouping in upcoming releases.

quickVariantSelection.description: With quickVariantSelection, you can switch to multiple views (single table mode). It links to a SelectionVariant (filters) or SelectionPresentationVariant (filters and sorters) that you have added to your annotations.

enableMassEdit.description: Mass editing allows end users to simultaneously change multiple objects that share the same editable properties.

visibleFields.description: The 'visibleFields' property lets you specify which fields are available in the mass edit dialog.

ignoredFields.description: The 'ignoredFields' property lets you hide specific fields from the mass edit dialog, even if these fields are displayed in the table.

operationGroupingMode.description:
Define how the changes using mass edit should be applied. The default mode for mass editing is 'ChangeSet' on the Object Page and 'Isolated' in the List Report.

- ChangeSet: Grouped for all objects within the same request.
- Isolated: Separately for each object (as an individual OData change set in the same request).

selectionMode.description:
Allows you to enable or disable row selection and choose between single or multiple row selection.
- Auto: This type is deprecated. Choose any of the following modes:
- Multi (default): This type allows multiple table selections if relevant actions are available in the toolbar.
- Single: This type allows single table selection if relevant actions are available in the toolbar.
- None: No table selection is possible in display mode.

selectAll.description: The selectAll configuration overrides the selectionLimit and allows the user to select all the items. When set to true, the select all feature is enabled: a checkbox in the table header is displayed which selects all items when clicked.

selectionLimit.description: You can define how many items can be selected at a time using the selectionLimit.

enableExport.description: Defines whether the Export button is displayed in the table toolbar. The default value is true.

condensedTableLayout.description: Determines whether the content density for ui.table is condensed.

hierarchyQualifier.description: Leading property that decides between either a recursive hierarchy or data aggregation.

widthIncludingColumnHeader.description: Determines whether the column header is included in the column width calculation. By default, the column width is calculated based on the type of the content.

disableCopyToClipboard.description: Determines the visibility of the Copy to Clipboard button. By default, the Copy to Clipboard button is displayed in the table toolbar if the selection mode is configured.

rowCountMode.description:
Defines how the table handles the visible rows. Does not apply to responsive tables. Allowed values are Auto and Fixed.
 - Fixed: The table always has as many rows as defined in the rowCount property.
 - Auto (default): The number of rows is changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its row count to the space it is allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) but it cannot have less than defined in the rowCount property.
 - Interactive: The user can change the number of displayed rows by dragging a resize handle.

rowCount.description: Number of rows to be displayed in the table.

enableOnSelect.description: Enables single selection for a bound action.

position.description: Defines the position of the action relative to the anchor action.

requiresSelection.description: Indicates whether the action requires a selection of items.

text.description: The text that is displayed on the button (typically a binding to an i18n entry).

press.description: Relevant for extension actions; allows the definition of a target action handler.

visible.description: Defines if the action button is visible.

enabled.description: Defines if the action is enabled. The default value is true.

anchor.description: The key of another action to be used as placement anchor.

placement.description: Define the placement, either before or after the anchor action.

column.description: Defines whether the user can add and remove columns to a given table.

sort.description: Defines whether the user can sort a given table.

filter.description: Defines whether the user can filter data of a given table.

paths.description: List of annotation paths referring to SelectionVariant annotations.

hideTableTitle.description: You can hide the table and display only the titles of the tabs. To do so, add the hideTableTitle option and set it to true.

showCounts.description: You can show the counts of entries of each view. To do so, add the showCounts option and set it to true.

width.description:
A string type that represents CSS size values.
Refer to https://ui5.sap.com/api/sap.ui.core.CSSSize

availability.description:
Defines where the column should be shown.
Default: it will be shown by default in the table.
Adaptation: it will initially not be shown in the table but be available via end user adaptation.
Hidden: the column is neither available in the table nor in adaptation.

widthIncludingColumnHeader.description: By default, the column width is calculated based on the type of the content. You can include the column header in the width calculation using the widthIncludingColumnHeader setting in the manifest.json.

width.description:
A string type that represents CSS size values.
Refer to https://ui5.sap.com/api/sap.ui.core.CSSSize

availability.description:
Defines where the column should be shown.
Default: it will be shown by default in the table.
Adaptation: it will initially not be shown in the table but be available via end user adaptation.
Hidden: the column is neither available in the table nor in adaptation.

widthIncludingColumnHeader.description: By default, the column width is calculated based on the type of the content. You can include the column header in the width calculation using the widthIncludingColumnHeader setting in the manifest.json.

position.description: Defines the position of the column relative to the anchor column.

header.description: The header is shown on the table as header, as well as in the add/remove dialog.

width.description:
A string type that represents CSS size values.
Refer to https://ui5.sap.com/api/sap.ui.core.CSSSize

horizontalAlign.description: Aligns the header as well as the content horizontally.

availability.description:
Defines where the column should be shown.
- Default: it will be shown by default in the table.
- Adaptation: it will initially not be shown in the table but be available via end user adaptation
- Hidden: the column is neither available in the table nor in adaptation

properties.description:
If provided and sorting for the table is enabled, the custom column header can be clicked.
Once clicked, a list of properties that can be sorted by are displayed.

anchor.description: The key of another column to be used as placement anchor.

placement.description: Define the placement, either before or after the anchor column.

type.description: Defines the table type. Note: Grid tables, analytical tables, and tree tables aren't rendered on small-screen devices. Responsive tables are shown instead.

creationMode.description: Defines the page behavior when a new record is created.

enableFullScreen.description: Enables full screen mode for this table. This adds a button to the table toolbar which opens the table in a full screen dialog.

enablePaste.description: In the Object Page tables, it is possible to add several items at a time by copying and pasting data from an excel file, if this property is set to true.

Defines the personalization mode which is only effective if the variant management on the page is set to `Page` or `Control`.
By default all table settings are enabled. You can change this for the different parts of the table by setting the properties 'Column', 'Sort' and 'Filter' accordingly.
Omitting a property is treated as false, this allows apps to avoid getting new features like grouping in upcoming releases.

- None: No table selection is possible in display mode.

condensedTableLayout.description: Determines whether the content density for ui.table is condensed.

hierarchyQualifier.description: Leading property that decides between either a recursive hierarchy or data aggregation.

widthIncludingColumnHeader.description: Determines whether the column header is included in the column width calculation. By default, the column width is calculated based on the type of the content.

disableCopyToClipboard.description: Determines the visibility of the Copy to Clipboard button. By default, the Copy to Clipboard button is displayed in the table toolbar if the selection mode is configured.

rowCountMode.description:
Defines how the table handles the visible rows. Does not apply to responsive tables. Allowed values are Auto and Fixed.
 - Fixed: The table always has as many rows as defined in the rowCount property.
 - Auto (default): The number of rows is changed by the table automatically. It will then adjust its row count to the space it is allowed to cover (limited by the surrounding container) but it cannot have less than defined in the rowCount property.
 - Interactive: The user can change the number of displayed rows by dragging a resize handle.

rowCount.description: Number of rows to be displayed in the table.

name.description:
Defines the creation mode to be used by the table.
Allowed values are 'NewPage', 'Inline', 'InlineCreationsRows', 'External', or 'CreationDialog'.

- NewPage: The created document is shown in a new page, depending on whether 'Sync', 'Async', or 'Deferred' is specified in the metadata.
- Inline: The creation is performed inline
- InlineCreationsRows: The creation is performed inline with an empty row
- External: The creation is performed in a different application which is specified using the `outbound` parameter
- CreationDialog: The creation is performed in the table using a dialog which allows you to specify some initial property values which are listed in 'creationFields'.

If the 'name' property is not set:
If 'navigation' is defined, the default value is 'NewPage'. Otherwise it is 'Inline'.

createAtEnd.description:
Specifies if the new entry should be created at the top or bottom of a table when `creationMode` is set to `Inline`.
The default value is `false`.

TableCreationModeInlineCreationsRowsOPGr.description: InlineCreationsRows creation mode for the grid table

If 'navigation' is defined, the default value is 'NewPage'. Otherwise it is 'Inline'.

creationFields.description:
Defines the list of properties that will be displayed in the creation dialog, when the creation mode is set to 'CreationDialog'.
The value is a comma-separated list of property names.

outbound.description: The navigation target where the document is created when `creationMode` is set to `External`.

inlineCreationRowsHiddenInEditMode.description:

The default value is `false`.

 - Fixed: The table always has as many rows as defined in the rowCount property.

rowCount.description: Number of rows to be displayed in the table.

name.description:
Defines the creation mode to be used by the tree table.
Allowed values are 'NewPage', 'Inline', or 'CreationDialog'.

- NewPage: The created document is shown in a new page, depending on whether 'Sync', 'Async', or 'Deferred' is specified in the metadata.
- Inline: The creation is performed inline.
- CreationDialog: The creation is performed in a table. There is a dialog which allows you to specify some initial property values which are listed in 'creationFields'.

If the 'name' property is not set:
If 'navigation' is defined, the default value is 'NewPage'. Otherwise, it is 'Inline'.

createInPlace.description:
Specifies if the new entry should be placed at the position computed by the backend (e.g. taking sorting into account).
The default value is `false`. When set to `false`, the new entry is placed as the first child below its parent.

isCreateEnabled.description: Defines the extension point to control the enablement of the "Create" button or "Create Menu" buttons.

enabled.description: Defines if the action is enabled. The default value is true.

anchor.description: The key of another action to be used as placement anchor.

placement.description: Define the placement, either before or after the anchor action.

position.description: Defines the position of the action relative to the anchor action.

text.description: The text that is displayed on the button (typically a binding to an i18n entry).

press.description: Relevant for extension actions; allows the definition of a target action handler.

visible.description: Defines if the action button is visible.

enabled.description: Defines if the action is enabled. The default value is true.

anchor.description: The key of another action to be used as placement anchor.

placement.description: Define the placement, either before or after the anchor action.

afterExecution.description: Settings that control the behavior after creating a new entry.

navigateToInstance.description: Allows you to disable the navigation. By default, navigation is automatically triggered after you have performed an action.

enableAutoScroll.description: Allows you to scroll to the newly created or changed item after you have performed an action.
